alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 4:08PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms with torrential rainfall will impact portions of southeastern Rutland and southern Windsor Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 407 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dorset to near Manchester Center to near Stratton. Movement was east northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chester, Woodstock, Windsor, Mount Holly, Ludlow, Cavendish, Mount Tabor, Weston, Andover, Ludlow Village, Perkinsville Village, Mt. Holly, Mt. Tabor, Danby, Reading, Baltimore, Springfield, Weathersfield, West Windsor and Pawlet. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 40 and 49, and between mile markers 51 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized minor, poor drainage flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland; Western Windsor
